content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start by cleaning off the dead squirrel at the top of the route. Then go back to the bottom and establish yourself in between two sections of moss just to the left of Alarm Clock keeping to the right of the massive undercling and side pull that are on The Crack of Dawn. The start is a low large ledge on the left for a hand press and a really good low sidepull on the right. Goes straight up from these holds.
content.location: Look for the hand press low ledge at the right side of the face of this boulder.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on a triangular flake and go up through noticeable pockets to the top.
content.location: Look for the triangular start hold left of the center of the boulder.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

The start is very close to that of On the Hour but a fun route nonetheless. Feet will overlap between routes but hands do not. Start in the crack to the right of the start pockets on On the Hour. Move up and right to a sloper ledge. Continue up and right through horizontals to the topout.
content.location: Start is in the long crack in the middle of this face. Moves right through the problem.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start in a deep pocket. Move up to another deep pocket with a great undercling inside. Move through the featured sloper section to the topout. May want to clean the slopers and some feet.
content.location: A few feet to the right of the right arete of the slab face. Look for the deep sloping pockets at the top of the route.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out.

Start at the bottom of the noticeable crack on the left side of the boulder, using the protruding hold at the bottom the crack (the undercling or a right hand on the crack itself is good form as well) and find good holds with your feet. Do an interesting move to stand up and walk up to the peak of the boulder just right of the arete. Avoid the left arete.
content.location: On the trailside slab face of the boulder. This route is the leftmost route on this face and starts at the bottom of the crack.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start is on the higher pointed hold and a good right handed ledge with feet out left. Find a way to stand up and move up through easy holds to the top.
content.location: Look for the featured bottom of this route right of center of the boulder.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out.

Starts in a deep sidepull jug. Goes up trending left to a deep jug right before the topout
content.location: Look for the deep side pull jug on the left side of the slab face.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start holds are the 2 deep pockets at the bottom of the crack.  Follow good holds up and slightly right then back over the start holds and then to the top. There is a massive undercling on this route but it's not really necessary to use.
content.location: Start at the bottom of the obvious crack that goes down from the arete on the right side of the main face

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on a good left facing hold that is 2 feet left of the arete. Start also has great start feet. Goes up and just slightly left topping out at the point. Avoids the right arete
content.location: On the main face on the far right, th e 2 feet left of the arete of the arete start on the obvious hold and then go for the top out.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on a high left and lower right side pulls. Go straight up from the high left sidepull  through some nice ledges to the top.
content.location: A few feet left of the noticeable triangular flake that is the start of the problem to the right.
